resources.string: Casual, airy cafe with a European menu and weekend breakfast buffet, plus pastries, coffee and wine.
Chic, elegant and pretty in white, this is a tea parlour meets café, located in the porch of the High Gates Hotel on Church Street. Housed in a quiet corner.
Local branch of a fast food restaurant whipping up burgers, hotdogs and smoked dishes.
Welcoming cafe and art gallery space serving dishes made from natural ingredients.
Casual cafe serving variety of eats such as pizzas, sandwiches & pastas, along with sweet treats.
A globally-influenced menu of green smoothies and light meals, served in a peaceful dining room.
A 12-minute walk from a metro station, this refined hotel is 2 km from the lavish Tipu Sultan\'s Summer Palace and 4 km from Lalbagh Botanical Garden.
Surrounded by gardens, this polished resort is 14 km from Bangalore Palace and 17 km from the ISKCON Temple Bangalore.
Set 1.4 km from Kodigehalli Railway Station, this relaxed hotel in a functional, modern building is 4 km Lumbini Gardens artificial beach and 9 km from Bangalore Palace.
This relaxed, rural safari lodge lies in a rehabilitation facility for lions and tigers rescued from circuses. It\'s 8 km from both the Bannerghatta Zoo and the Butterfly Park.
Set in the central neighbourhood of Sampangi Rama Nagara, this vibrant hotel is an 8-minute walk from Sree Kanteerava Stadium and 2.6 km from the Lalbagh Botanical Garden.

A 13-minute walk from Nadaprabhu Hiriya Kempegowda Majestic metro station, this upmarket hotel is 15 minutes\' walk from Bengaluru City Junction Railway Station and 2 km from the science centre at the Jawaharlal Nehru Planetarium.
On a busy commercial street, this laid-back hotel is a 9-minute walk from the nearest metro stop, 4 km from the 16th-century Nandi Temple and 5 km from Lalbagh Botanical Gardens.

Lalbagh or Lalbagh Botanical Gardens, meaning The Red Garden in English, is a well-known botanical garden in southern Bengaluru, India. It has a famous glass house dating from 1889 which hosts two annual flower shows.

Bannerghatta National Park, near Bangalore, Karnataka, was founded in 1970 and declared as a national park in 1974. In 2002 a portion of the park, became a biological reserve, the Bannerghatta Biological Park.
Cubbon Park, Officially called Sri Chamarajendra Park is a landmark \'lung\' area of the Bengaluru city, located within the heart of the city in the Central Administrative Area.

Bangalore Palace, a palace located in Bangalore, Karnataka, India, in an area owned originally by Rev. J. Garrett, the first principal of the Central High School in Bangalore, now famous as Central College.
Tipu Sultan\'s Summer Palace, in Bangalore, India, is an example of Indo-Islamic architecture and was the summer residence of the Mysorean ruler Tipu Sultan.
Sri Radha Krishna Temple has deities of Radha and Krishna located at Rajajinagar, in North Bangalore, Karnataka, India. It is one of the largest ISKCON temples in the world.

The Vidhana Soudha located in Bengaluru, is the seat of the state legislature of Karnataka. It is constructed in a style sometimes described as Mysore Neo-Dravidian, and incorporates elements of Indo-Saracenic and Dravidian styles.

The Visvesvaraya Industrial and Technological Museum, Bangalore, India, a constituent unit of the National Council of Science Museums, Ministry of Culture, Government of India, was established in memory of Bharat Ratna Sir M Visvesvaraya.
